notes: Compact car on K platform. Saved Chrysler from bankruptcy. Available as sedan, coupe, or wagon. Front-wheel drive. Sister car to Plymouth Reliant. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Aries article, January 2025 revision.

Revolutionary minivan that created the segment. Based on K-car platform. Shorter wheelbase than Grand Caravan. Replaced traditional station wagons. Car of the Year 1985. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Caravan article, January 2025 revision.

Sports coupe on G platform. Available with turbocharged engines. Shelby variants with enhanced performance. IROC R/T racing models. Replaced Challenger name temporarily. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Daytona article, January 2025 revision.

Compact hatchback sedan based on H platform. Replaced Challenger. Shelby Lancer variants available with turbo. European-influenced styling. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Lancer article, January 2025 revision.

Compact car on P platform. Replaced Omni. Available as 2-door or 4-door hatchback. Shelby Shadow performance variant. Sister car to Plymouth Sundance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Shadow article, January 2025 revision.

Rebadged Mitsubishi Mighty Max compact pickup. Sold by Dodge through Mitsubishi partnership. Available with diesel engine. Replaced by Dakota. Diesel service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Triton article, January 2025 revision.
